nodes.bodyText: @pruivo hey I think there are other trace messages that we might want to add here. For example "IRAC operation failed!" but I couldn't find any identifier (ISPN0000) and I'm not quite sure about them. Do you think we should add those messages here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,65 @@
+[id='xsite_logs-{context}']
+= Cross-Site Log Messages
+{brandname} prints different log messages related to cross-site replication.

nodes.bodyText: we don't allow TRACE in runtime (without restarting the server). You can enable DEBUG.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,53 @@
+[id='xsite_tshoot-{context}']
+= Collecting Logs and Troubleshooting Cross-Site Replication
+Diagnose and resolve issues related to {brandname} cross-site replication. Use
+the {brandname} Command Line Interface (CLI) to adjust log levels at run-time
+and perform cross-site troubleshooting.
+
+.Procedure
+
+. Open a terminal in `{server_home}`.
+. Create a {brandname} CLI connection.
+. Adjust run-time logging levels to capture DEBUG or TRACE messages if necessary.
++
+For example, the following command enables TRACE log messages for the org.infinispan.XSITE category:
++
+[source,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+[//containers/default]> logging set --level=TRACE org.infinispan.XSITE

@@ -0,0 +1,53 @@
+[id='xsite_tshoot-{context}']
+= Collecting Logs and Troubleshooting Cross-Site Replication
+Diagnose and resolve issues related to {brandname} cross-site replication. Use
+the {brandname} Command Line Interface (CLI) to adjust log levels at run-time
+and perform cross-site troubleshooting.
+
+.Procedure
+
+. Open a terminal in `{server_home}`.
+. Create a {brandname} CLI connection.
+. Adjust run-time logging levels to capture DEBUG or TRACE messages if necessary.
++
+For example, the following command enables TRACE log messages for the org.infinispan.XSITE category:
++
+[source,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+[//containers/default]> logging set --level=TRACE org.infinispan.XSITE
